bach.DataFrame.from_model#

classmethod DataFrame.from_model(engine, model, index, all_dtypes=None)[source]#

Instantiate a new DataFrame based on the result of the query defined in model.

If all_dtypes is not specified, then a transaction scoped temporary table will be created with 0 result rows from the model. The meta data of this table will be used to deduce the dtypes.

Parameters

  • engine (sqlalchemy.engine.base.Engine) – a sqlalchemy engine for the database.

  • model (sql_models.model.SqlModel) – an SqlModel that specifies the queries to instantiate as DataFrame.

  • index (List[str]) – list of column names that make up the index. At least one column needs to be selected for the index.

  • all_dtypes (Optional[Dict[str, str]]) – Optional. Mapping from column name to dtype. Must contain all index and data columns. Must be in same order as the columns appear in the the sql-model.

Returns

A DataFrame based on an SqlModel

Return type

bach.dataframe.DataFrame

Note

If all_dtypes is not set, then this will query the database and create and remove a temporary table.
